briefTitle: A Study to Test the Safety and Efficacy of Sitagliptin Compared to Glimepiride in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes on a Stable Dose of Metformin (0431-803)(COMPLETED)
officialTitle: A Phase III, Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of the Addition of Sitagliptin Compared With the Addition of Glimepiride in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus With Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin
conditions: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, Non Insulin Dependent
summary: A study to see if better control of type 2 diabetes can occur in patients taking a stable dose of metformin when they are also provided either sitagliptin or glimepiride. This study will also see if this treatment is safe and tolerable.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 30
